This code seems to imply that "org.eclipse.core.runtime" has not been added to 
the plug-in registry (I assume the null pointer is "descriptor"). In the 
eclipse/workspace/.metadata directory there are 2 files: .cache.properties 
and .lock (no .log) file. The .cache.properties file contents is:
 
#Fri Feb 08 15:06:28 EST 2002
location=/var/tmp/platform/
index=1013198788167.index.properties
prefix=1013198788167

Are you just unzipping the drop and running the eclipse executable or is there 
something special about your setup? 

Specifically, is there anything different about the location of your plugins 
and workspace?

I've been able to run both the Jan. 25 stable build and the Feb. 5 integration 
build on our Solaris machine.  The system setup is:

OS version:     5.8
Processor type: sparc
Hardware:       SUNW,Sun-Blade-100
Window Manager: CDE 1.4

I tracked the problem down to eclipse/install/platform.cfg. The scenario for 
duplicating this problem is as follows:

1) install Eclipse in any directory (e.g., /tmp). The contents of the 
eclipse/install directory is effectively empty.
2) Run eclipse. This creates several files in the install directory, namely 
platform.cfg. This properties file has an entry site.0.url= which now contains 
the directory where eclipse was first run.
3) Move eclipse to some other directory. (mkdir /tmp/xxx; 
mv /tmp/eclipse /tmp/xxx). During the startup sequence, this site.0.url 
property is used to detect the existing plugins. Since the directory no longer 
exists, there are no plugins (e.g., no org.eclipse.core.runtime). 

Suggestion: If the value for the site.0.url property does not exist, maybe it 
should be re-evaluated again.

I believe that this has been fixed in the latest integration build.
Moving to Platform/Update for confirmation.

The inital content of the platform.cfg now uses the "platform" protocol for the 
default site URL. This makes it relative to the location from which BootLoader 
was loaded (the current platform install tree).

Was fixed in 20020205 build (possibly the integration build before than).
